Keith Jarrett is known for his unique style of jazz, which integrates elements of classical music, free jazz, and gospel music. He often plays with a very lyrical, melodic style, incorporating a wide range of dynamics and rhythms. His improvisations have a very organic feel, as he often allows the music to unfold on its own, responding to the other musicians in his group or to his surroundings.

Jarrett is also known for his use of the piano as a percussion instrument, often incorporating the sound of the keys and even the pedals into his playing. This gives his music a very organic, earthy feel that is distinct from other pianists in the jazz tradition.

Overall, Keith Jarrett's style of jazz is marked by his incredible improvisation skills, his ability to blend multiple genres and influences, and his use of the piano as a percussive instrument.
